items.title: All Terrain
items.description: All-terrain tires offer drivers traction on- and off-road, and are typically used by light truck and SUV drivers who want a tire that's able to climb rocks and perform on the highway.

items.title: All Season
items.description: Most common: Good handle on dry, wet or snow

items.title: Highway
items.description: Highway terrain tires are commonly used on light trucks and SUVs that typically haul materials or need to conquer highways and some off-road terrains.

items.title: Mud Terrain
items.description: Mud Terrain tires offer drivers traction on off-road terrains such as mud, dirt, sand, gravel, and rock, and are commonly used on CUVs, SUVs, light trucks, and jeeps.

items.title: Winter
items.description: For snow, ice, and freezing temperatures

items.title: All Weather
items.description: Combines an All Season and Winter tire traits for strong traction year-round

items.title: Commercial Van
items.description: Also known as cargo tires, commercial van tires feature a C at the end of the tire's size and are built with durable, long-lasting materials to help drivers as they haul packages in pickup and delivery applications.

items.title: Touring
items.description: For durability and smooth long rides

items.title: Sport
items.description: Sport Trucks typically feature a wide, low profile and offer drivers responsive handling and strong traction on paved roads.

header.subtitle: Consistently rated as excellent by 245-75r16 drivers
Most popular among drivers in PA
Check out the sale price on this tire
Consistently rated as excellent by 245-75r16 drivers

content.body:
### Shop LT245/75R16 Tire Size Wheels and tires on light trucks have trended toward bigger sizes for quite a few years, but the LT245/75R15 can still be found on a lot of older pickups and SUVs dating back to the late 90s and 2000s. Trucks like the Chevy C2500 Suburban, older-generation F150, older-generation RAM 1500, Chevrolet Silverado 1500 and Jeep Wrangler all roll on LT245/75R15 tires, and there’s still a lot of those trucks on the road today. Most drivers of light trucks prefer all-season tires, so there’s models like the Bridgestone Dueler H/L Alenza Plus, Michelin Defender LTX M/S, [Kumho Crugen HT51](https://simpletire.com/brands/kumho-tires/crugen-ht51), or Nokian One H/T to choose from. Popular vehicles: 2002-2006 Chevrolet Avalanche 2500
2003-2021 Chevrolet Express 2500
1996-2003 Ford F150
1999-2006 Chevrolet Sierra 1500
1997-2020 Jeep Wrangler
1998-2010 Mazda B Series Maybe you’ve got a 4x4 truck or you just like to do a little more demanding driving with the occasional foray off-road. All-terrain tires offer a great compromise between ride quality and road manners on the highway and reliable traction off the pavement; check out tires like the Toyo Open Country A/T III, BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO2, Falken Wildpeak A/T3W, and [Pirelli Scorpion All Terrain Plus](https://simpletire.com/brands/pirelli-tires/scorpion-all-terrain-plus). If you like getting down and dirty in the mud, there are tires like the [Yokohama Geolandar M/T G003](https://simpletire.com/brands/yokohama-tires/geolandar-m-t-g003), Hankook Dynapro MT2 RT05, Firestone Destination M/T2, and Dick Cepek Extreme Country. If your locale has rough winters with lots of ice and snow, dedicated winter tires like the [Bridgestone Blizzak DM-V2] (https://simpletire.com/brands/bridgestone-tires/blizzak-dm-v2), Nokian Hakkapeliitta LT 3, Nexen Winguard Winspike, and Hankook Winter i Pike (RW11) are all great picks for the winter months. Whether you drive a Chevrolet Express 2500, Jeep Wrangler, Mazda B Series, or something else, SimpleTire has a set of LT245/75R16 tires that meets your needs at a great price!

info.title: Did you know?
info.body: A reliable brand is the #1 ask for most drivers. Here you can shop all the most popular brands and discover new ones – all tested, ranked and rated by our customers.
